As a matter of fact, the very origin of the word " Parliament " is found in the old French word "parler," which, adopted hi England after the Norman invasion!, and contracted into " parle," meant to speak, debate, or discourse,_ as shown by the word " parlement," which is the origin of the word spelt as it is to-daya gathering of persons to parley, discourse, debate, or discuss. essence of the word "Parliament" shows -that we are a debating bod;--that the primary purpose of the institution is debate. As to the assertion that it exists to supervise legislation, how, may I ask, would it be possible for Parliament to f u l f i l that function unless the inherent power existed to discuss the propositions submitted to it?
